definition: annihilation (of soul, Sanskrit uccheda)
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: Many hundreds of different physical illnesses also consume your time.
sentences.chinese: 從身所生多百疾病，其類非一亦能斷滅。

sentences.english: In the declining period of the Buddha-dharma, the first Sutra to disappear will be the Shurangama Sutra.
sentences.chinese: 《楞嚴經》在佛法末法的時候是先斷滅的。

the five impurities (Buddhism)
to extinguish worries and the sea of grief/nirvana (Buddhism)
the Nirvana sutra: every living thing has Buddha nature.

the Four Noble Truths (Budd.), covered by the acronym 苦集滅道: all life is suffering 苦, the cause of suffering is desire 集, emancipation comes only by eliminating passions 滅|灭, the way 道 to emancipation is the Eight-fold Noble Way 八正道

three principles and five virtues (idiom)/the three rules (ruler guides subject, father guides son and husband guides wife) and five constant virtues of Confucianism (benevolence 仁, righteousness 義|义, propriety 禮|礼, wisdom 智 and fidelity 信)
